intro: Taeniophyllum fasciculatum, commonly known as the clustered moss or small moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, mat-forming plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a dense, cushion-like growth habit with closely packed, leaf-like structures called phyllidia. Its reproductive structures, known as archegonia, are usually located on the underside of the leaves. Taeniophyllum fasciculatum plays an important ecological role in nutrient cycling and soil stabilization in its native habitats.
